page.title: 07HOUSING IN DENTON
page.content: The housing of west{Denton}and{Dane {bank}is varied in character. It ranges from rows of nineteenth century terraces to modern semi-detached houses. The area has seen great changes resulting from the construction of the{M67}which now cuts the town in half. Much old terraced property was demolished leaving a few remnants here and there to remind us of a town and a way of life now gone. The newer semi-detached privately owned houses make up the majority of the areas housing, especially in Dane Bank, although some terraced council rented property is found. The planners of the 1930's and 1950's tried hard to make a pleasent living environment. Quite tree_lined roads are the norm, Too quite for the younger inhabitants interviewed.For the bulk of the residents, life is comfortable.
